result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity: Initial appearance

3:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Armon Devon Mims appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Shanna Sanders appeared by video for Armon Devon Mims. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Cash bond set of $500.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim C.J or C.L., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No contact with Co Defendant Daimon Smith or juvenile C.C. No driving. If released curfew from 7pm to 7am. No possession of any weapons. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 3PM.
